attributes.action: construct a new war memorial to lost heroes who have passed through Wootton Bassett in recent overseas conflicts.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: We have all seen images of the lost soldiers pass through Wootton Bassett, those who have died in Afghanistan over recent months.  Many of us have not been able to attend the passing of these heroes through the town and would appreciate a memorial where we could recognise their bravery when visiting later.  A new memorial to these brave men and women could not only recognise the heroes themselves and Wootton Bassett for its dedication to the dead but it would enable us to visit and pay our respects at a later date.

rejection.details:
Statues and memorials are not normally sponsored by central Government but usually result from private initiatives. The promoters of a statue or memorial can achieve their aims by setting up a Charitable Trust, identifying a site and commissioning a designer, raising the necessary finance and obtaining the appropriate consents from the relevant planning authorities.

You may also wish to sign one of these petitions instead:
http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/Wootten/
http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/WoottonBassett/
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
